bibl.title: Letter to from Catherine E. Seth to William Houston Lazear, January 29, 1922

div1.p: Catherine Lazear provides family news and recalls the day of William Lazear's birth.

div1.head: Letter to from Catherine E. Seth to William Houston Lazear, January 29, 1922

opener.dateline:
WINDSOR MILL FARM
WINDSOR MILL ROAD & GWYNN'S FALLS
WALBROOK, BALTIMORE, MD.
Jan 29, 1922

div1.p:
I have had you in my
mind much today as were are having
just such a snow storm as we had
23 years ago - about the time you were
born - almost all: transportation had stopped
Wet people were coming to us to get milk just
as they are today, among them was
your good Father, who had walked out
in the storm to get a supply for his
family so happy & proud was he over
the birth of his son. I think he came
AC
Ame to Bu
partly to have us rejoice with him
your B-grandmother was with us at
that time talking about the fine boy
that had arrived in the Lazear family,
I hope you are enjoying you new home &
not finding the cold climate too much
for you. I will be interested hearing
from you. I shall hope to see you at
Windsor some time in the near
future. Frances is having busy time
now. looking after her many cares, among which now
is trying keep the house warm for
her old Mother & for the comfort of the
two little girls who are boarding with
us- who are now having the meals
I am too nervous
to write any more
Coz F joins me
in Love.
